page.title: 10CRAWLEY HIGH STREET
page.content: The{London-Brighton turnpike}gave us the High Street, and the railway helped extend it south. C20th traffic jams eased in 1939 with a{by-pass.}The road today is choked with town centre traffic, moving slowly past level crossing, roundabout, pedestrians and traffic lights. Width changes mark the old{Green}and{Square}(fairs held until 1920's) but a central building is no more. The station has moved east but hotels and inns stand as reminders of former transport. Medieval and later houses mix uneasily with, or hide under, modern exteriors of banks, entertainment and glass fronts in a mixed streetscape. the street now has a fringe role to play in the C.B.D. Once varied shops are now offices, fast food outlets, computer sales etc, but the High Street is far from dead as it continues to respond to needs.
